title: Rafaela's walk-off triple sends Red Sox to playoffs
content: Ceddanne Rafaela tripled to drive in the game-ending run in the ninth inning Friday night, giving the Red Sox a 4-3 victory over the Tigers and clinching Boston's first postseason berth since 2021.

title: Europe quiets U.S., up 3 after Day 1 of Ryder Cup
content: Tommy Fleetwood, Rory McIlroy and Jon Rahm didn't lose a match in the first two sessions Friday, while Scottie Scheffler and Bryson DeChambeau failed to earn a point, allowing the Europeans to take a 5.5-2.5 lead on the U.S. at the Ryder Cup.

title: Bradley not worried about Scheffler, defends picks
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley defended his pairings picks and said he's not worried about Scottie Scheffler, who was winless in two matches Friday and will be in action again Saturday morning.

title: Purdy good to start for Niners after sitting out 2
content: After missing the past two games with a toe injury, 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy is healthy and will start against the Jaguars.

title: NFL HQ building shooter diagnosed with CTE
content: Shane Tamura, who killed four people and then himself in a July shooting at the NFL HQ building, was posthumously diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy, according to a statement from the New York City Officer of the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Panthers star Barkov has surgery on ACL, MCL
content: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov is expected to miss seven to nine months after having surgery to address ACL and MCL injuries to his right knee, the team announced Friday.

title: Sources: LSU RB Durham doubtful vs. Ole Miss
content: LSU running back Caden Durham, who injured his ankle last week against SE Louisiana, is doubtful for Saturday's game against Ole Miss, sources told ESPN.

title: Kane nets 100th Bayern goal; bests Haaland, CR7
content: Harry Kane reached 100 goals for Bayern Munich with his second strike against Werder Bremen on Friday, making European history in the process.

title: What happened on Day 1, and what it means for the rest of the Ryder Cup
content: Can Scottie Scheffler and Team USA turn things around? What can we expect from Saturday morning's matches. We breakdown the first day and look ahead to Day 2.

title: Everything left to play for during MLB's final weekend
content: There's still a lot at stake entering the final weekend of the regular season. We have your guide to the last few days of baseball before October.

title: Inside the Gundy-Oklahoma State divorce
content: After 20 years together, Gundy and the Pokes split. It was the culmination of a great run and internal strife.

title: 'This season he is better than ever': Haaland is becoming the complete striker for Man City
content: The goals are still flowing for Erling Haaland, but his growth as a leader and an all-around contributor has made him invaluable to Pep Guardiola and Manchester City.

title: Liverpool's Chiesa is 'here to win' and now has the chance to prove it
content: Federico Chiesa has struggled at times after moving to Liverpool, but he has a chance to reignite his career.

title: From The Big Dumper to ... magic? Why Mariners might have the mojo to finally win it all
content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 4: Elic Ayomanor, Chargers D/ST among top options
content: Do injuries have you seeking a late-week pickup? Need a defense to stream? We have options with favorable setups.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Mayfield shines, Skattebo is fantasy's top rookie
content: Does Baker have Philly's number? Will the Giants rookie be a lineup lock going forward? Don't be surprised.

title: Micah Parsons' hobby? Beating Packers teammates at HORSE, pingpong and bowling
content: "We just building relationships," Parsons said of competing with his new teammates ahead of Sunday's return to Dallas.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Ranking boxing fights: Fundora-Thurman, Parker-Wardley, more
content: From Sebastian Fundora's title bout, to the junior middleweight debut of "Boots" Ennis, ESPN picks October's best fights.

title: Penn State RBs Nicholas Singleton and Kaytron Allen doing record things
content: Despite scouts placing the pair in the first two days of the NFL draft, they returned for one more year.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Dortmund's Guirassy as Lewandowski successor
content: Barcelona have added Borussia Dortmund striker Serhou Guirassy to their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ranking every World Cup mascot: From World Cup Willie to Maple, Zayu and Clutch
content: Now that the 2026 World Cup mascots have been revealed, ESPN ranks every competition's mascot from worst to first dating back to 1966.

title: 'I'm pulling for you': Roger Staubach surprises Brian Schottenheimer at news conference
content: It was the first interaction Schottenheimer, who was named head coach on Jan. 24, has had with the Hall of Fame quarterback.

title: Arizona State, West Virginia lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: Arizona State is going with all-black threads for its Friday night showdown, while West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965.

title: Chase Briscoe finally feeling like he belongs among NASCAR elite
content: Chase Briscoe is Cup Series winner, but always felt like he had something to prove. In his first year at Joe Gibbs Racing, he's doing just that.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Pakistani military pleaded for cessation of fighting during Operation Sindoor: India exercises Right of Reply at UNGA
content: This Assembly witnessed absurd theatrics in the morning from the Prime Minister of Pakistan, First Secretary in India's Permanent Mission to the UN Petal Gahlot said

title: High Court seeks instructions on NDPS special courts
content: The court was hearing a batch of petitions, including by Ernakulam native Sumi Joseph, the mother of two school-going children, seeking effective measures by the State government to curb the use of narcotic.

title: GCDA to hand over Kaloor stadium to SKF for preparations ahead of Argentina’s match
content: SKF will carry out the necessary infrastructure upgrades based on a detailed plan. Traders operating in the shops surrounding the stadium will need to be temporarily relocated or shut down, says GCDA

title: Rains LIVE: Heavy rains lash Odisha as depression nears coast; CM reviews preparedness
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast “heavy rain and thunderstorms with lightning” in parts of Andhra Pradesh until October 2

title: Engaged with Trump administration, other stakeholders: India on H-1B visa fee hike
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said the mobility of skilled talent has contributed enormously to innovation, economic growth and wealth creation in both the U.S. and India

title: JJP criticises Haryana govt. for income limit in new scheme for women
content: The BJP during the election had promised ₹2,100 monthly financial assistance under the scheme to all women, says party’s youth wing State president Digvijay Chautala

title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
content: An official said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

title: Every penny of Rangla Punjab to be used for flood-hit people: CM Mann
content: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
content: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‘Divyang warriors’, producing medal-winning para-athletes and IT professionals. Vijaita Singh and Naveen Kumar report on how the facilities on campus give the injured a new lease of life

title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
content: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‘custodial brutality’

title: DRDO wins businessline’s Changemaker of the Year Award for its strategic technology
content: The Azim Premji Foundation won the Iconic Changemaker Award for its pioneering and extensive work in education and healthcare

title: CBI coordinates return of UAPA accused from UAE
content: Parminder Singh was wanted by the Punjab police in a case of alleged extortion, raising funds for terrorist acts, attempt to murder and criminal intimidation

title: Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA for his 'provocative speeches': Ladakh administration
content: Time and again, it has been observed that Wangchuk has been indulging in activities prejudicial to the security of the state and detrimental to maintenance of peace and public order and services essential to the community, the Directorate of Information & Public Relations (DIPR), Ladakh said in a statement here.

title: Punjab Ministers blame Centre of ‘step-motherly’ attitude towards Punjab; Congress demands probe on floods
content: What’s even more troubling is the Prime Minister’s announcement of a paltry ₹1600 crore relief package, of which not a single rupee has been disbursed to Punjab to date, says Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema

title: New farming technology holds potential to stop desertification
content: The researchers have essentially carried out modification of desert sand into soil using polymers for reaping its full agricultural potential

title: Stalin inaugurates civic amenities set up at cost of ₹41.83 crore
content: The projects include upgraded sports facilities at Bharathidasan Stadium in Shenoy Nagar and amenities at parks in Koyambedu and Ramapuram

title: CEO of Hong Kong firm alleges ₹15-crore cargo fraud
content: B. Subramanyan says the Container Freight Station in Vallur near Kattupalli Port unlawfully released his company goods to the importers without the original bills of lading or valid Delivery Orders; he alleges that his subsequent inquiries had revealed a larger conspiracy involving 21 individuals, including representatives of the import firms, shipping companies, and officials of the freight station

title: R. Venkataramani re-appointed as Attorney General
content: The President is pleased to re-appoint Shri R Venkataramani, Senior Advocate, as Attorney General for India for a further period of two years with effect from 01.10.2025, a notification read.

title: Renovation of open-air auditorium begins at Cusat
content: The structural changes will be implemented as per the recommendations made by a four-member technical committee appointed by the Syndicate after the tragic stampede that occurred on November 25, 2023

title: Police said Sonam Wangchuk was being taken to Jodhpur, says wife
content: Gitanjali Angmo said she was yet to receive a copy of the formal detention order. “We will prepare the legal response once we get a copy of the order,” she said. Ladakh Buddhist Association president Cherring Dorjay Lakruk pledges legal support for Sonam Wangchuk.

title: NISAR satellite sends first radar images of Earth’s surface
content: The images display details with which NISAR scans Earth to provide unique, actionable information to decision-makers in a diverse range of areas

title: BPF leads in Assam’s Bodoland council polls
content: The party was leading in 21 of the autonomous council’s 40 seats, more than 12 hours after the counting of votes began at 8 a.m. on Friday. The UPPL and ally-turned-rival BJP are set to win almost as many seats as in the 2020 polls.

title: Congress slams detention of Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, demands judicial probe into violence that left four youth dead
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says detention was meant to divert attention from BJP’s failure to ensure security, Sixth Schedule status in Ladakh; Congress Ladakh chief slams “police firing” against protestors

title: Zubeen Garg death: Women’s ODI World Cup opening ceremony toned down
content: BCCI is consciously moving marquee cricket matches out of tier 1 cities to attract more girls to cricket, Secretary Devajit Saikia says

title: Science Ministry survey on R&D in India gets weak response from private sector
content: The latest edition of the survey was launched in December 2024 with firms given time until September 30, 2025 to submit responses; the deadline may be extended now

title: AAP attacks BJP over Sonam Wangchuk’s detention
content: Drawing parallels to Ravana, Hitler, and Mussolini, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responds to activist’s detention by warning of the downfall of “those who practice dictatorship and arrogance”

title: Bareilly tense as police personnel and protesters clash over poster row
content: The protest was against the police FIR against people who carried ‘I Love Muhammed’ posters at a Kanpur procession on September 4

title: Tile-by-tile restoration brings back the lost splendour of Paigah Tombs in Hyderabad
content: After decades of neglect, destruction, and encroachment, the tombs are now being restored by the State government and the Aga Khan Trust for Culture, with funding from the U.S. State Department’s Ambassadors Fund for Cultural Preservation

title: QuantM: A game-changer for milk safety and farmer livelihoods
content: What makes the innovation even more powerful is its integration with NIAB’s rapid antimicrobial sensitivity kit, as a result the two tests can confirm both the presence of mastitis and the most effective treatment within two hours — a process that typically takes two to three days in conventional labs

title: Recall Char Dham project judgment: Murli Manohar Joshi, environmentalists to Supreme Court
content: Environmentalists have argued that cutting hill slopes and the resulting debris are damaging to the eco-system and worsen the impact of landslides and torrential rains as well as cause massive roadblocks and pile-up on these mountain roads.

title: Elon Musk Named In New Epstein Files, He Responds
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has been named in the highly controversial Jeffrey Epstein files among other high-profile figures like Bill Gates, Prince Andrew, and Trump ally Steve Bannon.

title: UN Security Council Rejects Russia, China's Bid To Delay Iran Nuclear Sanctions
content: The U.N. Security Council rejected last-ditch effort to delay the reimposition of sanctions on Iran over its nuke program a day before the deadline and after Western countries claimed that weeks of meetings failed to result in a "concrete" agreement.

title: Iran Says US Was Never Serious On Nuclear Talks
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said Friday that US President Donald Trump's administration has not shown sincerity in nuclear talks, including negotiations before an Israeli strike.

title: Trump Urges Microsoft To Fire Ex-Biden Administration Official
content: US President Donald Trump called on Microsoft on Friday to fire its head of global affairs, Lisa Monaco, a former senior official in Democratic administrations.

title: S Jaishankar Stresses Multilateralism, UN Reforms At BRICS Meet In US
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday hosted a meeting of the BRICS Foreign Ministers in New York, highlighting the bloc's pivotal role in promoting multilateralism and constructive international engagement.

title: Pak Security Forces Kill 17 Taliban Militants In Raids In Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: Pakistani security forces on Friday raided a militant hideout in the country's restive northwest, triggering a shootout that left 17 Pakistani Taliban fighters dead, police said.

title: Yogi Adityanath Directs Authorities To Show No Mercy For Unrest Conspirators
content: Calling Dussehra a festival dedicated to vanquishing evil and terror, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday urged authorities to impose strict punishments on those intent on creating unrest and disturbances within the state.

title: At UN Address, Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus Calls For Revival Of SAARC
content: Bangladesh interim government Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus on Friday called for the revival of the SAARC grouping, stressing regional cooperation based on mutual respect, transparency, and shared prosperity.

title: US Supreme Court Lets Trump Withhold $4 Billion In Foreign Aid
content: he U.S. Supreme Court sided again on Friday with Donald Trump, allowing his administration to withhold about $4 billion in foreign aid authorized by Congress for the current fiscal year as the Republican president pursues his "America First" agenda.

title: Father Kills 13-Year-Old Daughter For Stealing Money From Home In UP: Cops
content: A 40-year-old man was detained for allegedly strangling his minor daughter to death here, police said on Friday.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrested Under Stringent NSA, Taken To Jodhpur: Sources
content: Ladakh statehood activist Sonam Wangchuk, who faces allegations of inciting a mob with provocative statements, has been arrested a day after he said he would be "happy to be arrested anytime for this cause".

title: Netanyahu Says Palestinian State Would Be "National Suicide" For Israel
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday in an angry UN address to block a Palestinian state, accusing European leaders of pushing his country into "national suicide" and rewarding Hamas.

title: Zubeen Garg's Manager, Festival Organiser Summoned For Questioning: Sources
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the death of Zubeen Garg has issued summons to Shyamkanu Mahanta, who organised the Northeast India Festival in Singapore, and the singer's manager, Siddhartha Sarma, to join the investigation by October 6

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrest Live Updates: Sonam Wangchuk Shifted To Jodhpur Hours After Being Arrested: Sources
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk has been shifted to Jodhpur in Rajasthan hours after being arrested under stringent National Security Act, according to sources.

title: PM Modi To Launch, Inaugurate Projects Worth Rs 60,000 Crore In Odisha Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Odisha on Saturday to lay the foundation stone and inaugurate multiple development projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore in Jharsuguda, an official statement mentioned on Friday.

title: Harjit Kaur Among 2,400 Indians Sent Back From US This Year: Foreign Ministry
content: Since the beginning of this year, more than 2,400 Indians have been sent back from the United States, the Ministry of External Affairs confirmed on Friday.

title: After 80 Years Of Male Leadership, Global Calls Intensify For UN's First Female Chief
content: In its 80-year history, the United Nations has never had a woman serve as secretary-general -- a fact that some world leaders now view as a glaring symbol of gender inequality at the highest level of global diplomacy.

title: Ladakh Leaders Demand Judicial Probe, Allege Cops Fired At Protesters
content: Demands are growing louder for a judicial probe into police firing that killed four people and left over 30 injured after protests demanding statehood for Ladakh turned violent.

title: BMW To Recall At Least 331,000 Vehicles Due To Engine Fire Risk
content: BMW AG is recalling at least 331,000 vehicles globally due to a defect in its starter motor, another such setback for the German carmaker that's been hit by costly product flaws.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: How Panthers line up without Barkov, Tkachuk
content: The Florida Panthers will be without both Aleksander Barkov and Matthew Tkachuk after Barkov suffered a knee injury.

title: India says NATO chief’s remarks on Modi-Putin talks ‘entirely baseless’
content: Speculative or careless remarks that misrepresent the Prime Minister’s engagements are unacceptable, says MEA Spokesperson

title: Thadou, Meitei leaders seek disqualification of BJP MLA Paolienlal Haokip
content: Question his Indian citizenship, accuse him of ‘engineering’ the conflict because State govt. wanted to remove Any Kuki Tribe from Manipur’s ST list

title: NEET-PG: Supreme Court issues notice on pleas for transparency
content: The top court, however, questioned why there were only 20 aggrieved candidates from among the two lakh who appeared for the examination

title: Tangedco Junior Engineer, four other staff suspended
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the deceased gangman K. Prabhakaran (40) was roped in to install four electrical poles on a new plot in Vilankuppam village on September 23.

title: ‘Students should blend science and ethics to become global citizens’
content: Delivering his inaugural address at the 16th edition of graVITas, Mr. Mansoori said that students should be creative and compassionate thinkers to achieve a balance between progress and sustainability in their career.

title: Vellore Corporation to focus on UGD work, community dogs sterilization, road re-lay: Mayor
content: Most of the councillors highlighted the need to conduct monthly council meetings as against the existing practice of once in three or four months as such an arrangement will allow them to air public grievances regularly.

title: Union Minister Amit Shah visits poll-bound Bihar for two days
content: Amit Shah is on a two-day visit to Bihar to mull over poll preparedness and seat distribution among NDA allies for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Calcutta HC directs repatriation of six West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh
content: “Not following such procedure and acting in hot haste to deport them is a clear violation which renders the deportation order bad in law and liable to be set aside,” the Bench noted.

title: Veritas Sainik School in Tirupati added for spot counselling
content: It is aimed at providing candidates a wider choice of schools, says a circular from the Sainik Schools Society

title: Govt readying vision to make Telangana aerospace capital: Minister Sridhar Babu
content: Phase-2 of Aerospace and Defence Cluster, dedicated Aerospace MSME Park on the cards, special task force to expedite approvals proposed

title: Gauhati HC grants bail to Kuki Inpi spokesperson in NIA case on killing of Manipur commandos
content: Court questions NIA over filing two FIRs for same incident; notes improbability of Kuki planning attack with Meitei suspect

title: In 2019, three Ministries gave nod to Ladakh’s tribal status
content: Ministries of Home, Tribal Affairs, and Law, and NCST concurred on Sixth Schedule; but in 2022, Home Ministry said UT administration was ensuring “development” that tribal status would bring

title: BJP demands White Paper on cooperative bank scam
content: BJP national executive committee member P.K. Krishnadas says LDF government has ruined the cooperative sector in the past 10 years

title: Take ₹10,000 from NDA govt. but don’t vote for them, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tells Bihar women
content: Targeting the ruling BJP-JD(U), the Congress leader asks why they didn’t think of women’s welfare for all these 20 years they have been in power. When the BJP failed in seeking votes in the name of caste, religion, infiltration and hollow speeches, it started new tactics of vote chori (vote theft), she says.

title: Lokesh announces setting up of international law university, probe panel on SKU irregularities
content: The university to come up in Amaravati will begin admissions in the 2025-26 academic year, with 20% seats reserved for local students, says Education Minister in Andhra Pradesh Assembly

title: Enforcement Directorate grills Bengal minister for second consecutive day in teachers’ recruitment scam
content: A special court in Kolkata on September 24, 2025, had rejected the central agency's plea for Chandranath Sinha's custody in this connection with their investigation of the matter

title: AFSPA extended in parts of Manipur, Arunachal and Nagaland for another six months
content: In Manipur, AFSPA has been extended in the whole State, except in jurisdictions of 13 police stations in five valley districts

title: Telangana government provides 42% quota for BCs in local bodies
content: Order issued providing quota in seats and positions in local bodies to BC communities; The order has been issued based on the evidence, legal sanction and judicial recognition and in view of the urgent necessity to ensure welfare, empowerment and full participation of backward classes, says BC Welfare Secretary

title: Congress inaugurates Manmohan Singh library at party headquarters
content: Facility with 1,200 books opened on former Prime Minister’s 93rd birth anniversary; family members and senior leaders present

title: Union ministry’s award for SCTIMST scientist
content: R.S. Jayasree selected for the Women in Medicine Award by the National Academy of Medical Sciences under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

title: Lawyers urged not to represent accused in Zubeen Garg death case
content: The CID of Assam Police issued notices to people who were linked to or aware of the events leading to the iconic singer’s death to appear within 10 days

title: A.P. will emerge as national logistics hub, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: CM announces in the Assembly that 14,966 km of roads will be developed at a cost of ₹4,500 crore, while national highway projects worth ₹1.5 lakh crore are already under way, placing A.P. second in the country for highway density

title: Chief Secretary directs swift action on disease outbreaks and flood preparedness
content: Vijayanand instructs District Collectors to contain diarrhoea and gastroenteritis cases, repair drinking water pipelines, set up medical camps, and stay alert as Godavari and Krishna rivers swell amid heavy rainfall forecasts.

title: BMTC’s NICE Road service emerges top performer: Nearly 38 lakh passengers carried, ₹17.13 crore earned in revenue
content: The service, popularly known as NICE-10, connects Madavara on Tumakuru Road with Electronics City by making use of the NICE Road that links Tumakuru Road with Hosur Road

title: Thrissur’s ‘Meet Your Collector’ reaches 50th episode
content: Interactive platform connects students and other citizens with governance.  On September 27, the 50th edition will be held at Muniyattukunnu Hill Station in Varandarappilly

title: Survey picks up even as State govt. says participation is not mandatory
content: Teachers who abstained from data collection return to survey duty in Belagavi and Bagalkot districts

title: 'No degree of drama can conceal facts': India responds to Pak PM's remarks at UN; slams 'absurd theatrics'
content: India strongly rebutted Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s UN General Assembly address, labeling his remarks as "absurd theatrics" and accusing Pakistan of glorifying terrorism. Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot highlighted Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists and its role in the Pahalgam attack. Sharif, conversely, accused India of unprovoked aggression, targeting civilians, and falsely claimed shooting down Indian jets.

title: Rajasthan horror: Newborn found with mouth glued, buried alive under stones in forest
content: Police in Bhilwara arrested an unmarried woman and her father for burying her 20-day-old newborn under stones with glue in his mouth to conceal an illegal birth. A shepherd discovered the infant, leading to a prompt police rescue and hospital admission.

title: ‘We have sharp eyes’: Gurgaon cop stalks digital creator using her car number
content: A Gurgaon police constable was suspended and an FIR registered after he used official channels to trace a 50-year-old digital creator's car registration. Finding her "attractive," he tracked her Instagram, commenting on her movements and admitting his identity, deeply disturbing the woman who later filed a complaint. Police took action after her video went viral.

title: Historic! Sanju Samson breaks Dhoni’s record for most T20I sixes
content: Sanju Samson has now become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in terms of sixes, surpassing MS Dhoni's record with 55 maximums. Despite adapting to different batting positions, he showcased his destructive power, contributing a vital 39 runs against Sri Lanka. His consistent ability to clear boundaries and adaptability make him a crucial asset for India's upcoming Asia Cup final.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: All isn't well with how Sonam Wangchuk's career has gone
content: Sonam Wangchuk, the inspiration for the '3 Idiots' protagonist, has emerged as a prominent political activist for Ladakh. He has undertaken multiple hunger strikes, demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule protection for the region's indigenous people, citing concerns over resource exploitation post-Article 370 abrogation. His latest fast concluded after violent protests erupted across the region.

title: After Operation Sindoor, LeT moves deep into Pakistan
content: UN-designated terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba is relocating its operational and training infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa to evade Indian strikes. Satellite imagery confirms a new facility, Markaz Jihad-e-Aqsa, is under construction in Lower Dir, 47km from the Afghan border, replacing a hub destroyed by the Indian Army. Key masterminds have been assigned leadership and instructional roles at this new site.

title: 'Go back to Pakistan': Hasina backers protest Bangladesh's Yunus at UN
content: Bangladesh's interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus faced protests at the UNGA in New York, where Sheikh Hasina's supporters accused him of bias and poor governance. Critics allege his administration allowed attacks on minorities and strained ties with India by blaming them for hosting Hasina. Yunus addressed the UN on Bangladesh's post-uprising journey.

title: 'Menace to national security': Trump orders Microsoft to fire global affairs head
content: Donald Trump publicly demanded Microsoft fire Lisa Monaco, its president of global affairs, labeling her a "menace to US National Security." This action is part of his ongoing retribution campaign against officials who oversaw federal investigations into his conduct, including Monaco's role as former Deputy Attorney General coordinating the Jan 6 response. Trump had previously revoked her security clearance.

title: Asia Cup: Injury scare for India? Bowling coach shares updates on Abhishek Sharma, Pandya
content: India had an injury scare as Hardik Pandya and Abhishek Sharma left the field during the Sri Lanka clash, but bowling coach Morne Morkel confirmed both suffered only cramps. While Hardik will be reassessed before the Pakistan final, Abhishek is fit. Morkel admitted India haven’t played a “complete game” yet and stressed sharper execution across departments.

title: Epstein files: Musk appears in newly released papers; possible island visit in 2014
content: Elon Musk's name appeared in the Jeffrey Epstein files. Other prominent figures like Prince Andrew and Peter Thiel are also mentioned. Democratic lawmakers released these documents. They show possible interactions between Epstein and these individuals. Musk may have visited Epstein's island in 2014. This was after Epstein was a registered sex offender. The revelations raise new questions.

title: Silicon Valley Billionaire warns: H-1B policy may backfire; Indian engineers at risk
content: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: 'Man of peace': At UNGA, Sharif backs Trump's claim of mediation
content: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif delivered a bizarre UN speech, falsely claiming victory over India and praising Trump for a ceasefire. Meanwhile, Trump's new 100% tariff on imported branded drugs has unsettled markets, raising concerns for India's $10bn pharma exports, especially if branded generics are included, prompting a search for new markets.

title: India rejects as baseless Nato chief's claim PM Modi quizzed Putin on war
content: MEA strongly refuted Nato chief Mark Rutte's claims that PM Modi questioned Russian President Putin about his Ukraine strategy due to US tariffs. The MEA asserted no such conversation occurred, urging Nato for greater accuracy in public statements. India continues its discounted Russian oil imports, defending them as vital for national economic security.

title: Asia Cup: 'If anyone speaks against India, I will...'- Yograj Singh warns Pak ahead of final
content: Former India pacer Yograj Singh strongly condemned the on-field spat between Indian and Pakistani players during the Asia Cup Super Fours. He fiercely defended young Indian batters Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, blaming Pakistan pacers for initiating verbal abuse. Singh's comments intensify the already charged rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final.

title: Travis Kelce rumoured to star in Taylor Swift’s 'The Fate of Ophelia' video
content: Taylor Swift fans are speculating Travis Kelce will appear in her "The Fate of Ophelia" music video, fueled by a lip-read comment from a behind-the-scenes clip. Theories suggest Swift wants "him" in the video, potentially rewriting Ophelia's tragic story to incorporate her real-life romance. The highly anticipated video premieres October 3.

title: Gisele Bündchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio after years together
content: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

title: Asia Cup: Jayasuriya hails Abhishek; slams loophole in cricket law after Super Over drama
content: Sri Lanka coach Sanath Jayasuriya lauded Abhishek Sharma’s fearless batting and Pathum Nissanka’s valiant century but raised concerns over “grey areas” in cricket laws after a controversial Super Over call. A caught-behind decision, later overturned, nullified a clear run-out, with the rule deeming the ball dead. Jayasuriya urged a review of such loopholes in the laws.

title: India cites Trump, flags EU double standards
content: India firmly rejected EU concerns over its Russian oil imports, highlighting US President Trump's criticism of European nations for their continued energy purchases from Russia. New Delhi asserted there cannot be double standards on the matter, even as EU officials ruled out sanctions against India.

title: Your suit is not maintainable in Delhi, HC tells Sameer Wankhede
content: Delhi HC questioned the maintainability of IRS officer Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against the Netflix series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. Wankhede seeks an injunction for his alleged misleading portrayal, but the court specifically asked if the cause of action arose in Delhi. This query came despite arguments that the series was viewed and reactions emerged from the city.

title: Kirk’s past attacks on Taylor Swift resurface after his death
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: Cardi B honors Stefon Diggs with bold fashion; addresses romance rumors
content: Cardi B turned heads on "Call Her Daddy" by styling a custom Stefon Diggs jersey, simultaneously confirming her pregnancy with the NFL star. Expecting her fourth child, the rapper also vehemently dismissed bizarre breakup rumors, including claims about her BBL. She underscored her happiness and strong, supportive relationship with Diggs, navigating career demands and family growth.

title: Makena White death: How Jake Knapp’s girlfriend died at 28
content: PGA Tour golfer Jake Knapp's girlfriend, Makena White, passed away suddenly at 28. A friend shared the news on Instagram. Makena was from Ottawa, Canada. She graduated from McMaster University. She worked in surgical sales. Makena and Jake began dating in August 2023. They went public after his Mexico Open win. The golf world expressed shock and sadness.

title: Did Adele turn down 2026 Super Bowl? Here’s what’s happening
content: Conflicting reports surround Adele's potential 2026 Super Bowl halftime show. While some outlets claim she declined the offer, possibly due to security concerns, others maintain active negotiations with the NFL and Roc Nation are ongoing. This isn't Adele's first Super Bowl consideration, having rejected a 2016 offer. Fans eagerly await official confirmation as her status remains firmly "to be determined."

title: Asia Cup | Nissanka’s blazing century in vain; IND edge SL in Super Over
content: Pathum Nissanka’s maiden T20I century (107 off 58) went in vain as India overcame Sri Lanka in a dramatic Super Over to maintain their unbeaten run in the Asia Cup. Earlier, Abhishek Sharma (61) and Sanju Samson (39) powered India to 202/5, the tournament’s highest total, before Sri Lanka’s late push dragged the contest into a tense finish.

title: 'Dirty cop': Trump lauds FBI’s Kash Patel for Comey indictment; labels him 'total slimeball'
content: US President Donald Trump praised FBI director Kash Patel and the agency for the recent indictment of former FBI chief James Comey, whom he called a "dirty cop." Comey faces charges of false statements and obstructing Congress, which he denies. Since returning to office, Trump has reportedly used his powers to target opponents, suggesting more indictments are forthcoming.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt stuns in Dolce & Gabbana ahead of Ravens game
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently shared highlights from her lavish New York City trip, featuring her boyfriend Derek Green and parents. She also discussed how her family keeps her grounded, emphasizing faith, family, football, and philanthropy, alongside her long-standing relationship with Green, whom she has known since childhood.

title: Voter registered in multiple seats can't contest polls: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court today ruled that candidates registered as voters in multiple constituencies are barred from contesting elections. Dismissing the Uttarakhand SEC's appeal, the apex court upheld the High Court's stay on a circular that permitted such candidates in panchayat polls, deeming it contrary to statutory provisions.

title: Supreme Court does U-turn, validates JSW takeover of Bhushan Steel
content: The Supreme Court reversed its earlier decision, reinstating JSW Steel's revival plan for bankrupt Bhushan Power and Steel Limited. This ruling allows JSW to continue transforming BPSL into a profitable entity after a significant Rs 20,000 crore investment, upholding the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code's objectives and the Committee of Creditors' commercial wisdom.

title: Jake Knapp’s girlfriend Makena White dies at 28, Golf World pays tribute
content: The golf world mourned the sudden death of Makena White. She was 28 years old and the girlfriend of PGA Tour golfer Jake Knapp. Her friend confirmed her passing on Instagram. Tributes poured in from fans and golf figures. Makena supported Knapp during his career highlights. She was with him for his first PGA Tour win.

title: Prostate cancer and back pain: What’s real and what’s misleading
content: Prostate cancer incidence in the US shows a concerning rise, particularly in advanced stages. While early prostate cancer often lacks symptoms, back pain can be a sign of metastasis to the bones, especially the spine. However, most back pain is unrelated to cancer, stemming from muscle strains or other issues.

title: Warbird MiG-21 flies into history
content: India's iconic MiG-21 warbird completed its final flight from Chandigarh after six decades of service. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh presided over the decommissioning, hailing it as a transformative symbol of India's air power and its strategic partnership with Russia. He praised its versatility across multiple roles, establishing India's global air power.

title: Delhi HC lets Priya file Sunjay's assets list in sealed cover
content: Delhi High Court permitted Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit her late husband Sunjay Kapur's asset list in a sealed cover. This concerns a suit filed by Sunjay's children from his marriage with Karisma Kapoor. The court also ensured lawyers would not discuss the case publicly. A copy of Sunjay's will goes to his mother.

title: Not a med emergency: Generic pharma cos spared from harm
content: Trump's new 100% pharma levy primarily targets branded and patented medicines, potentially impacting Sun Pharma and Biocon's US sales. While most Indian generic firms anticipate business as usual, some may shift high-value production to US facilities or diversify markets.

title: 'Unwarranted': India pulls up Turkey's Erdogan over UN speech; what triggered row?
content: India strongly rejected Turkish President Erdogan's "objectionable" remarks on Jammu and Kashmir at the UNGA, reiterating it's a strictly bilateral issue with Pakistan requiring no third-party mediation. New Delhi lodged a strong protest, emphasizing that such statements on India's territorial integrity are unacceptable. India also highlighted Pakistan's cross-border terrorism as the root cause of the problem.

title: Explained: Why was Shanaka given not out even after getting 'out'?
content: In a dramatic Asia Cup Super Over, Sri Lanka's Dasun Shanaka survived a clear run-out due to a cricket law technicality. After being given out caught behind, which he reviewed, Shanaka was run out while the ball was deemed "dead" by the umpire's initial decision. DRS overturned the caught-behind, but Law 20 protected him, baffling players.

title: India, Russia agree to boost farm trade
content: India and Russia agreed to significantly increase agricultural trade and strengthen bilateral cooperation following a meeting between Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Russian Deputy PM Dmitry Patrushev. Discussions focused on enhancing agricultural ties, with Russia expressing keen interest in formalizing a partnership through a Memorandum of Understanding. Chouhan highlighted international collaboration for farmer welfare and food security.

title: NDA's DBT 'Brahmastra': Rs 10k for 75 lakh women - Will it be a game changer in Bihar polls?
content: The Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government launched a Rs 7,500-crore DBT scheme, transferring Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women for empowerment. PM Modi used the virtual launch to attack the RJD, urging women to ensure NDA's return. This election-eve initiative, similar to successful schemes elsewhere, faces opposition criticism as a voter bribe.

title: 5 ancient breathing techniques to lower blood pressure and boost heart and lung health
content: Pranayama is an ancient yogic practice that focuses controlled breathing to balance mind and body. Ancient breathing techniques or Pranayama, have proven to reduce cortisol levels, regulate the autonomic nervous system, and improve heart rate variability. Beyond physiological benefits, breathing techniques have emerged as simple yet powerful tools to restore balance, clarity, and inner calm.

title: OIL confirms natural gas find in Andaman sea
content: Oil India Ltd has definitively established the presence of natural gas in the Andaman Sea for the first time, marking a significant find at the Sri Vijayapuram-II well. Initial testing confirmed natural gas with 87% methane, leading the oil minister to express hopes for a "Guyana-scale discovery.

title: Silver at record high! Price hits Rs 1.41 lakh/kg; gold up Rs 330/10g
content: Silver prices reached a new record high in India. Gold also gained in the national capital. Strong festival demand and investor interest fueled these increases. Global uncertainties supported safe-haven purchasing. Domestic bullion markets showed strength despite international trends. Analysts anticipate continued support for precious metals.

title: Mike McCarthy unfiltered drops truth on Andy Reid & Travis Kelce explosive clash
content: Travis Kelce was seen shouting at Andy Reid during a high-pressure Week 3 game on September 22, 2025. Dallas Cowboys coach Mike McCarthy later defended the heated moment, stating it reflected a deep bond and mutual respect built over their decade-long partnership, rather than anger. He emphasized it showed their strong relationship.

title: Asia Cup | Kohli records broken! Nissanka hits ton against India
content: Sri Lanka mounted a spirited chase against India, reaching 157/2 in 15 overs while pursuing 203. Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Perera built a crucial 127-run partnership. Nissanka recorded his fifth T20 Asia Cup fifty, surpassing Virat Kohli's record for most 50-plus scores and setting a new record for the biggest partnership in the tournament.

title: Sonam Wangchuk arrested under NSA, mobile internet blocked in Leh
content: Ladakh Police arrested activist Sonam Wangchuk on Friday under NSA charges. This action followed violent clashes in Leh where four protesters died. Mobile internet was suspended as a precautionary measure. Wangchuk had ended his hunger strike for Sixth Schedule protection and statehood. His FCRA license was revoked earlier. Ladakhi organizations planned further talks with the MHA committee.

title: LG announces reopening of 12 tourist destinations in J&K closed after Pahlagam attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha reopened 12 tourist destinations after a crucial security review meeting, asserting that the war against terrorism is not over. He directed forces to remain on high alert and continue stringent action against the terror ecosystem. These sites, closed following an April 22 attack, will reopen from September 29.

title: News: Red Sox, Guardians look to lock down playoff berths
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the final series for all MLB teams begins today, with several playoff questions still needing to be answered . a win over the Detroit Tigers or a loss to the los Angeles Angels can clinch a playoff spot today .

title: 15 more NFL Week 4 games, 15 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: the "Get Up" crew debates which team, the Ravens or the Chiefs, is under pressure to get a win ahead of their game Sunday . quarterback quarterback Jaxson Dart will make his debut against the surging Chargers . the 1-2 teams will face off in an AFC showdown .

title: The real reason Mike Gundy got dumped
content: Dabo Swinney: "you have to constantly reinvent, reinvest, reset, learn, grow. You change" the business of college football in 2025 is different from 2015. Direct revenue-sharing, NIL and the transfer portal have altered the way rosters are assembled .

title: Why Daniel Jones has flourished in Indy, and what could still derail his season
content: Daniel Jones is off to an excellent start in his first season with the Indianapolis Colts . he's the only player in the past 90 years with at least three rushing touchdowns, three passing touchdowns and no turnovers over the first three games of a season . Jones is the league leader in Total QBR (85.8) .

title: Packers-Cowboys rivalry rewind: From the Ice Bowl to Micah Parsons' Dallas return
content: the history between the Green Bay Packers and Dallas Cowboys runs deep . ex-teammate Micah Parsons won't be last Todd Archer and Dan Graziano . his biggest meetings are loaded with potential future Hall of Famers .

title: Everything you need to know about Oregon-Penn State, Bama-Georgia and a blockbuster Week 5
content: the Crimson Tide travel to Georgia on friday night . it's the first trip to athens, Georgia, in a decade . resurgent Florida State visits a wonderfully surprising Virginia team . last week's merciless blowout of Illinois, Indiana hailed a harrowing victory .

title: 'That's Guard ball': Inside the chaotic approach that has fueled the Guardians' epic rise
content: the inning came in the bottom of the sixth in the opening game of a crucial series between the Cleveland Guardians and Detroit Tigers . the two rivals had been going in opposite directions for the better part of the month . all-world pitcher Tarik Skubal was nursing a 2-0 lead, meaning the end of the Tigers were just a few innings away .

title: Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: U.S. trails Europe after Day 1
content: team Europe fielded Rory McIlroy, Robert MacIntyre, Tommy Fleetwood, Justin Rose, Rasmus Hjgaard and Tyrrell Hatto . team Europe finished day 1 with a three-point lead -- 5.5 to 2.5 .

title: How the Aces beat the Fever to move one win away from the WNBA Finals
content: the Las Vegas Aces beat the Indiana Fever 84-72 in their WNBA semifinal series . the first game of the night features the 1-seeded Minnesota Lynx attempting to come back from Tuesday night's overtime loss to the Phoenix Mercury in their tied semifinals series (ESPN2)

title: 📈 NBA Rank: Top 100 players for 2025-26
content: the "NBA Today" crew discusses a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . our 2025 NBA Rank wraps up as we break down the final top 10 players in the league . we asked our expert panel to vote on player vs. player matchups .

title: NBA Rank 2025: What league insiders say about the top 100
content: a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . we reached out to scouts, coaches and executives across the league to get their feedback on our new top 100 for 2025-26 . some of the biggest questions and points of contention from our latest edition of NBA Rank .
